title: The National Archives (United Kingdom)
summary: The National Archives (TNA, Welsh: Yr Archifau Cenedlaethol) is a non-ministerial government department.[2]  Its parent department is the Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.[3]  It is the official archive of the UK government and for England and Wales; and "guardian of some of the nation's most iconic documents, dating back more than 1,000 years."[4] There are separate national archives for Scotland (the National Records of Scotland) and Northern Ireland (the Public Record Office of Northern Ireland).
